Dear Harold:
I polled the Publications Committee, in line with your request, concerning
the possibility of reduced rates for members of other organizations for sub¬
scriptions to our publications, if we could interest such organizations in
allowing reduced rates for their publications to our Individual Members.
Nine of the ten committee members have replied to date.
1. Asked whether they thought the idea was worth exploring, 7 say yes, 1 is
heartily opposed, and 1 has large reservations. (Actually, I get the definite
impression that the 7 who say yes are thinking primarily of their own interests
—what such a savings on publications of other organizations might mean to
them—rather than as members of an NAEB committee and what such an arrangement
might mean to the NAEB. The other 2 are opposed or dubious because of poten¬
tial loss of income to the NAEB, because of questions about how you open the
door for such arrangements to one organization while closing it on another,
and because of the likelihood that it would be more trouble in promoting,
bookkeeping etc. than it would be worth.)
2. Asked what organizations and/or publications they would suggest, these
were named:
1 Journal of Broadcasting (6)
2 A-V Communication Review (5)
3 Television Quarterly (4)
4 Quarterly Journal of Speech (3)
5 Audiovisual Instruction (2)
6 Journal of the SMPTE (2)
7 Journalism Quarterly (1)
8 Television Digest (l)
9 Speech Monographs (1)
10 Speech Teacher (1)
11, E.B.U. Review (1)
12 AERA Journal (1)
13 AHE Journal (1)
14 Any newsletter which the Center for Programed Learning may put out (1)
15 British and European journals (1)
